competitors.name: Adidas
competitors.market_position: Nike's biggest competitor globally and in India, with a strong presence in the athletic footwear and apparel market; second largest in terms of sales.

competitors.name: Anta
competitors.market_position: Chinese sportswear brand competing strongly with Nike in the Asia-Pacific region, including targeting Gen Z consumers.

competitors.name: Li-Ning
competitors.market_position: Another major Chinese sportswear brand competing with Nike in the Chinese market and among Gen Z consumers via hyper-localized strategies.

competitors.name: Asics
competitors.market_position: Competitor in the athletic footwear segment, known for technical running shoes; smaller market share than Nike but recognized in the performance category.

competitors.name: Puma
competitors.market_position: International sportswear brand competing with Nike in footwear and fashion segments, including targeting younger demographics.

competitors.name: Under Armour
competitors.market_position: Athletic apparel and footwear brand competing with Nike, with growing presence in performance and lifestyle categories.

competitors.name: Fila
competitors.market_position: Sportswear brand competing in footwear and fashion segments, known for a retro and streetwear appeal attractive to younger consumers.

competitors.name: New Balance
competitors.market_position: International footwear brand competing in running and lifestyle categories, increasingly popular among Gen Z for its fashion styling.

competitors.name: Skechers
competitors.market_position: Global footwear brand competing primarily on comfort and casual fashion, appealing to broader age groups including younger buyers.

competitors.name: Lululemon
competitors.market_position: Primarily an athletic apparel brand competing with Nike in premium yoga and fitness wear, with increasing appeal to Gen Z in urban markets.
